Text:
(Did our runaway princess stab her betrothed to elope
with an illicit lover?)
(...She didn't seem one for trysts.)

(Gotta say, puttin' a hole in Perv and going on the
run is pretty hardcore...although as a moocher extra,
it kinda sucks to lose a patron.)

It's okay, everything's cool. Win the next, one and
it'll cancel out my loss here.

That last match was just, uh...fine-tuning.
Yeah, that's it.

I was just checkin' for errors with my power level
counter, seein' if it matched the level of this
tourney. An upfront investment, you could say...

(The real side character thing to do would be to hit
the streets and find a new sugar mama, but that feels
a bit too much like being a pick-up artist.)

(No, hold up. Now really isn't the time to be acting
like an extra.)

(We're in the middle of what looks to be a really
important event, so the shadowbroker is definitely
gonna need to step in at some point...)

(A secret feud plays out behind the pomp and splendor
of the big tournament...)
Yeah, I like the sound of that.
Right?

But now my battle scouter is complete! And ya
know, Cid, all I need to put the finishing touch on
my flawless victory is a little capital...
...Huh, where'd he go?

(Still, being essential to the main scenario is one
of the tough parts of being a shadowbroker.)

As I walk down the hall lost in these thoughts,
I pass by someone in a robe.
...You smell like elves.

A husky female voice comes from beneath the slightly
frayed robe.
Huh?
Do you know any elves?
Her blue eyes give me a searching look.
I'm friends with a few, yeah.

There isn't any reason to keep that hidden, so I give
her a straight answer.
I'm looking for an elf.
Oh, really.
A cute one.
Huh.
Sound familiar?
That's not a lot to go on.

She would look a lot like me. She's the child of my
younger sister.
I see.
So have you seen any elves that look like me?
Uh...
Have you?
Um, I can't see your face with your hood up.
...Oh, right.
The woman removes her hood and reveals her features.
//ムービー再生

She frowns as if disappointed, then draws her sword
in a fluid motion.

A lethal strike, with no tension or telegraphing to
give it away.

I see it out of the corner of my eye and let it
happen.
(I know what you're doing.)
(You're gonna stop at the last second, huh.)
(So I'll just be a good extra, and...)
Agh!

(Act like I'm scared and fall back on my ass.
Yep, I'd say that was passable.)
Hm?

The woman tilts her head curiously and withdraws her
steel.
Sorry, I misjudged you.
I thought you were made of sterner stuff.
What's your name?
She offers me her hand as she speaks.
Cid Kagenou...

I reply in a shaky voice and accept her help in
standing up.
I'm Beatrix.
Beatrix maintains her grip on my hand.
Um...
It's a good hand. You'll grow stronger.

She offers me a pretty smile...one that strongly
resembles Alpha's.
Sorry for startling you.

After offering one more apology, Beatrix turns
and walks away.
I look down at my hand, then turn and leave as well.
...She might be a heavy-hitter.
